remarks: Continuity of the metric function; analogue of ~ cnmpt22f which cannot be used directly because ` D ` is not necessarily a function. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 5-Oct-2015.)
statement:
cnmpt1ds.d $e |- D = ( dist ` G ) $.
cnmpt1ds.j $e |- J = ( TopOpen ` G ) $.
cnmpt1ds.r $e |- R = ( topGen ` ran (,) ) $.
cnmpt1ds.g $e |- ( ph -> G e. MetSp ) $.
cnmpt1ds.k $e |- ( ph -> K e. ( TopOn ` X ) ) $.
cnmpt2ds.l $e |- ( ph -> L e. ( TopOn ` Y ) ) $.
cnmpt2ds.a $e |- ( ph -> ( x e. X , y e. Y |-> A ) e. ( ( K tX L ) Cn J ) ) $.
cnmpt2ds.b $e |- ( ph -> ( x e. X , y e. Y |-> B ) e. ( ( K tX L ) Cn J ) ) $.
cnmpt2ds $p |- ( ph -> ( x e. X , y e. Y |-> ( A D B ) ) e. ( ( K tX L ) Cn R ) ) $.
$d D x y $.
$d G x y $.
$d J x y $.
$d K x $.
$d R x y $.
$d X x y $.
$d Y x y $.
$d ph x y $.
